oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Early US Claim for damages by Confederate forces
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This is a precursor of the US Claims Commission to reimburse loyal Tennesseans for losses incurred during the war due to theft or impressment by the Confederate armies. This claim was filed by John B. Surguine of Hawkins County, Tennessee. His claim is for three hundred bushels of corn at 50 cents a bushel for a total claim of $150.00.
